decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's playthrough by using cards like Wasteland, Daze, and Force of Will while also applying constant pressure with aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Murktide Regent. It aims to control the board and tempo of the game with a mix of counterspells, efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat, and card draw/filtering cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also utilizes fetch lands to thin the deck and maximize the chances of drawing key cards.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures, then bringing them back into play using reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The deck has a mix of disruptive creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and finishers like Katara, Waterbending Master and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Utilizing a mix of control elements and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats from the graveyard.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through card draw and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Brainstorm, and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently disrupted. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student serves as a versatile card advantage engine, while Orcish Bowmasters provide additional removal options. Overall, the deck focuses on disruption and control to navigate the game in its favor.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and disruptive spells like Stifle to slow down the opponent. The deck aims to play Phyrexian Dreadnought along with Dress Down to quickly put a powerful threat on the board. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card advantage and searching for key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes some versatile removal options like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to deal with various threats. Overall, the deck focuses on disruption and tempo plays to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a win.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize, counter spells like Force of Will, and removal spells like Fatal Push. It also plays efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to pressure the opponent's life total. The deck focuses on controlling the game early on and then closing it out quickly with its aggressive threats. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for easy access to both blue and black spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes cards for card selection, protection, and mana acceleration to efficiently execute the combo. The key strategy is to carefully sequence your spells, use disruption to prevent your opponent from interfering, and utilize the powerful card selection options provided by Doomsday and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play early on in the game. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect the combo pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a big threat that they cannot deal with, securing the win through sheer power and efficiency. The deck's strategy revolves around setting up the combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This Legacy UR Aggro deck focuses on tempo and card advantage, utilizing efficient cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Brainstorm to control the board while deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. Mishra's Bauble provides card selection and triggers prowess for Dragon's Rage Channeler. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will to protect its game plan. Wasteland is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game throughout.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary mana and storm count to cast a game-ending Tendrils of Agony. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Cabal Ritual to generate a large amount of mana while also utilizing cards like Infernal Tutor and Wishclaw Talisman to find key combo pieces. Thoughtseize and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan while cards like Ad Nauseam and Necrodominance provide additional card advantage and flexibility. The inclusion of Urza's Saga and various artifact mana sources like Lotus Petal and Mox Opal help provide consistency and resilience to disruption.

The deck revolves around quickly dumping your entire library into your graveyard in order to win the game on the spot with Thassa's Oracle. It uses a combination of fast mana, discard spells, and creatures that enable you to accomplish this goal as early as the first turn. The deck is built to be a high-risk, high-reward strategy that can win out of nowhere if the opponent is unprepared to deal with such an explosive combo. It aims to create a fast and powerful combo that can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to react.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while maintaining pressure with evasive threats. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out to control the board, supported by disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach. The deck leverages tempo plays with cards like Daze and Brazen Borrower to keep opponents off-balance. Murktide Regent and Barrowgoyf provide powerful threats, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student offers card advantage and versatility. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes disruptive lands like Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to use the card Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play quickly. By combining this with cards like Omniscience and The One Ring, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. With a mix of cantrips, counter magic, and acceleration like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to set up its combo pieces efficiently and protect them from opposing disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill through your entire library by using cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, to then win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck is focused on assembling the combo pieces as fast as possible, using cards like Pact of Negation for protection and Cabal Therapy for disruption. With a strong emphasis on graveyard recursion and mana acceleration, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, then bringing them back into play using spells like Reanimate, Exhume, and Animate Dead. It aims to disrupt opponent's hands with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy while also utilizing cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal for fast mana acceleration. With a mix of reanimation spells and graveyard fillers, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats and win the game through powerful creature plays.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. By combining efficient removal like Fatal Push with hand disruption from Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence. In addition, utilizing cards like Dark Confidant for card advantage and Orcish Bowmasters for creature removal, the deck is able to maintain pressure and control over the game. With a strong mana base and diverse creature options, this Mono Black Aggro deck can quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Griselbrand into play using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Collective Brutality to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game through a combination of card advantage, powerful creatures, and disruptive spells, creating a powerful and fast-paced combo reanimator strategy.
